summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Him was life, and the life was the light of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all through him might believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That was the true Light which gives light to every man coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through Him, and the world did not know Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John bore witness of Him and cried out, saying, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of His fullness we have all received, and grace for grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?”
He said, “I am not.”
“Are you the Prophet?”
And he answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said: “I am
‘The voice of one crying in the wilderness:
“Make straight the way of the Lord,” ’
as the prophet Isaiah said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, saying, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, “Behold! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know Him; but that He should be revealed to Israel, therefore I came baptizing with water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and He remained upon Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘Upon whom you see the Spirit descending, and remaining on Him, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, the next day, John stood with two of his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking at Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, “What do you seek?”
They said to Him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, when translated, Teacher), “where are You staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said to them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (now it was about the tenth hour).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated, the Christ).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought him to Jesus.
Now when Jesus looked at him, He said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is translated, A Stone).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, and also the prophets, wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?”
Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?”
Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael answered and said to Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they ran out of wine, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does your concern have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of purification of the Jews, containing twenty or thirty gallons apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He said to them, “Draw some out now, and take it to the master of the feast.” And they took it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Every man at the beginning sets out the good wine, and when the guests have well drunk, then the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This beginning of signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this He went down to Capernaum, He, His mother, His brothers, and His disciples; and they did not stay there many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers doing business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My Father’s house a house of merchandise!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house has eaten Me up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews answered and said to Him, “What sign do You show to us, since You do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He was speaking of the temple of His body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when He had risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in His name when they saw the signs which He did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus did not commit Himself to them, because He knew all men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and had no need that anyone should testify of man, for He knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but cannot tell where it comes from and where it goes. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus answered and said to Him, “How can these things be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and do not know these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, We speak what We know and testify what We have seen, and you do not receive Our witness.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one has ascended to heaven but He who came down from heaven, that is, the Son of Man who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He who believes in Him is not condemned; but he who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And this is the condemnation, that the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone practicing evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his deeds may be clearly seen, that they have been done in God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He remained with them and baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had not yet been thrown into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose a dispute between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about purification.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified—behold, He is baptizing, and all are coming to Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before Him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God does not give the Spirit by measure.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into His hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who believes in the Son has everlasting life; and he who does not believe the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He needed to go through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his sons and his livestock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to her, “Whoever drinks of this water will thirst again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him will never thirst. But the water that I shall give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up into everlasting life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.”
Jesus said to her, “You have well said, ‘I have no husband,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; in that you spoke truly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at this point His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with a woman; yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went out of the city and came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “I have food to eat of which you do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the disciples said to one another, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not say, ‘There are still four months and then comes the harvest’? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, for they are already white for harvest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit for eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this the saying is true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have entered into their labors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many more believed because of His own word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we ourselves have heard Him and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things He did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had gone to the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will by no means believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nobleman said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your son lives.” So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, “Your son lives!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he inquired of them the hour when he got better. And they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” And he himself believed, and his whole household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This again is the second sign Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these lay a great multitude of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty-eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in that condition a long time, He said to him, “Do you want to be made well?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Rise, take up your bed and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And immediately the man was made well, took up his bed, and walked.
And that day was the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “He who made me well said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a multitude being in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father has been working until now, and I have been working.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered and said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do; for whatever He does, the Son also does in like manner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself does; and He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father raises the dead and gives life to them, even so the Son gives life to whom He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that all should honor the Son just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who hears My word and believes in Him who sent Me has everlasting life, and shall not come into judgment, but has passed from death into life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, the hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God; and those who hear will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father has life in Himself, so He has granted the Son to have life in Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not marvel at this; for the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and come forth—those who have done good, to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can of Myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is righteous, because I do not seek My own will but the will of the Father who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the witness which He witnesses of Me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sent to John, and he has borne witness to the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing for a time to rejoice in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a greater witness than John’s; for the works which the Father has given Me to finish—the very works that I do—bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Father Himself, who sent Me, has testified of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do not have His word abiding in you, because whom He sent, Him you do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You search the Scriptures, for in them you think you have eternal life; and these are they which testify of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not receive honor from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in My Father’s name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, him you will receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you believe, who receive honor from one another, and do not seek the honor that comes from the only God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think that I shall accuse you to the Father; there is one who accuses you—Moses, in whom you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me; for he wrote about Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus went over the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a great multitude followed Him, because they saw His signs which He performed on those who were diseased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus lifted up His eyes, and seeing a great multitude coming toward Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this He said to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may have a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two small fish, but what are they among so many?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those sitting down; and likewise of the fish, as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they were filled, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the fragments that remain, so that nothing is lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those men, when they had seen the sign that Jesus did, said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when Jesus perceived that they were about to come and take Him by force to make Him king, He departed again to the mountain by Himself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: got into the boat, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was already dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sea arose because a great wind was blowing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near the boat; and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “It is I; do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they willingly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day, when the people who were standing on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except that one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but His disciples had gone away alone—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: however, other boats came from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them and said, “Most assuredly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw the signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set His seal on Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Him, “What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they said to Him, “What sign will You perform then, that we may see it and believe You? What work will You do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the desert; as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to Me shall never hunger, and he who believes in Me shall never thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said to you that you have seen Me and yet do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I will by no means cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the will of the Father who sent Me, that of all He has given Me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him may have everlasting life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews then complained about Him, because He said, “I am the bread which came down from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered and said to them, “Do not murmur among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they shall all be taught by God.’ Therefore everyone who has heard and learned from the Father comes to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God; He has seen the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me has everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the bread of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread that I shall give is My flesh, which I shall give for the life of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who feeds on Me will live because of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread which came down from heaven—not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of His disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying; who can understand it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples complained about this, He said to them, “Does this offend you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then if you should see the Son of Man ascend where He was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and they are life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Therefore I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted to him by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also we have come to believe and know that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Did I not choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, for it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; for He did not want to walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one does anything in secret while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even His brothers did not believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it that its works are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go up to this feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, for My time has not yet fully come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when His brothers had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was much complaining among the people concerning Him. Some said, “He is good”; others said, “No, on the contrary, He deceives the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews marveled, saying, “How does this Man know letters, having never studied?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them and said, “My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wills to do His will, he shall know concerning the doctrine, whether it is from God or whether I speak on My own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not Moses give you the law, yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses therefore gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath, so that the law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But look! He speaks boldly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is truly the Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out, as He taught in the temple, saying, “You both know Me, and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they sought to take Him; but no one laid a hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the people believed in Him, and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than these which this Man has done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things concerning Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I shall be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said among themselves, “Where does He intend to go that we shall not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is this thing that He said, ‘You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone thirsts, let him come to Me and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his heart will flow rivers of living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this He spoke concerning the Spirit, whom those believing in Him would receive; for the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many from the crowd, when they heard this saying, said, “Truly this is the Prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others said, “This is the Christ.”
But some said, “Will the Christ come out of Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem, where David was?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division among the people because of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some of them wanted to take Him, but no one laid hands on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why have you not brought Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this Man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed in Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this crowd that does not know the law is accursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus (he who came to Jesus by night, being one of them) said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and look, for no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone went to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came to Him; and He sat down and taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the scribes and Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This they said, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they continued asking Him, He raised Himself up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw a stone at her first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the oldest even to the last. And Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had raised Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She said, “No one, Lord.”
And Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows Me shall not walk in darkness, but have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself; Your witness is not true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them, “Even if I bear witness of Myself, My witness is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from and where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You judge according to the flesh; I judge no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet if I do judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?”
Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, for His hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sin. Where I go you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself, because He says, ‘Where I go you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; for if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to Him, “Who are You?”
And Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father taught Me, I speak these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him, “If you abide in My word, you are My disciples indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How can You say, ‘You will be made free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, whoever commits sin is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a slave does not abide in the house forever, but a son abides forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if the Son makes you free, you shall be free indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know that you are Abraham’s descendants, but you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak what I have seen with My Father, and you do what you have seen with your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.”
Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You do the deeds of your father.”
Then they said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father—God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you not understand My speech? Because you are not able to listen to My word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I tell the truth, you do not believe Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is of God hears God’s words; therefore you do not hear, because you are not of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he shall never see death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word he shall never taste death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father who honors Me, of whom you say that He is your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I say, ‘I do not know Him,’ I shall be a liar like you; but I do know Him and keep His word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Most assuredly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I AM.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but that the works of God should be revealed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must work the works of Him who sent Me while it is day; the night is coming when no one can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated, Sent). So he went and washed, and came back seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind said, “Is not this he who sat and begged?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some said, “This is he.” Others said, “He is like him.”
He said, “I am he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “A Man called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ So I went and washed, and I received sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to him, “Where is He?”
He said, “I do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought him who formerly was blind to the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was a Sabbath when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath.”
Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” And there was a division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him because He opened your eyes?”
He said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked them, saying, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents answered them and said, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but by what means he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. He is of age; ask him. He will speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, for the Jews had agreed already that if anyone confessed that He was Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they again called the man who was blind, and said to him, “Give God the glory! We know that this Man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Whether He is a sinner or not I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they reviled him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God spoke to Moses; as for this fellow, we do not know where He is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered and said to them, “Why, this is a marvelous thing, that you do not know where He is from; yet He has opened my eyes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of one who was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “You were completely born in sins, and are you teaching us?” And they cast him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when He had found him, He said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “You have both seen Him and it is He who is talking with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Lord, I believe!” And he worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may be made blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we blind also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him, for they do not know the voice of strangers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used this illustration, but they did not understand the things which He spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “Most assuredly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a hireling, he who is not the shepherd, one who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care about the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the good shepherd; and I know My sheep, and am known by My own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flock and one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This command I have received from My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of them said, “He has a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem, and it was winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him, “How long do You keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in My Father’s name, they bear witness of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; neither shall anyone snatch them out of My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I and My Father are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Many good works I have shown you from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Him, saying, “For a good work we do not stone You, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, make Yourself God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods” ’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture cannot be broken),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do you say of Him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if I do, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they sought again to seize Him, but He escaped out of their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He went away again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was baptizing at first, and there He stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many came to Him and said, “John performed no sign, but all the things that John spoke about this Man were true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was that Mary who anointed the Lord with fragrant oil and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the sisters sent to Him, saying, “Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, when He heard that he was sick, He stayed two more days in the place where He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after this He said to the disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to Him, “Rabbi, lately the Jews sought to stone You, and are You going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if one walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things He said, and after that He said to them, “Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I go that I may wake him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then His disciples said, “Lord, if he sleeps he will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Jesus spoke of his death, but they thought that He was speaking about taking rest in sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Thomas, who is called the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus came, He found that he had already been in the tomb four days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about two miles away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met Him, but Mary was sitting in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, he shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever lives and believes in Me shall never die. Do you believe this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had said these things, she went her way and secretly called Mary her sister, saying, “The Teacher has come and is calling for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus had not yet come into the town, but was in the place where Martha met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and comforting her, when they saw that Mary rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And He said, “Where have you laid him?”
They said to Him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “See how He loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them said, “Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind, also have kept this man from dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, again groaning in Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Take away the stone.”
Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say to you that if you would believe you would see the glory of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when He had said these things, He cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come forth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who had died came out bound hand and foot with graveclothes, and his face was wrapped with a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Loose him, and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the Jews who had come to Mary, and had seen the things Jesus did, believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them the things Jesus did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council and said, “What shall we do? For this Man works many signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we let Him alone like this, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, and not that the whole nation should perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this he did not say on his own authority; but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not for that nation only, but also that He would gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, from that day on, they plotted to put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim, and there remained with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Passover of the Jews was near, and many went from the country up to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sought Jesus, and spoke among themselves as they stood in the temple, “What do you think—that He will not come to the feast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command, that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took a pound of very costly oil of spikenard, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who would betray Him, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money box; and he used to take what was put in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Let her alone; she has kept this for the day of My burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the poor you have with you always, but Me you do not have always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a great many of the Jews knew that He was there; and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests plotted to put Lazarus to death also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day a great multitude that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him, and cried out:
“Hosanna!
‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’
The King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, when He had found a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: His disciples did not understand these things at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about Him and that they had done these things to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people, who were with Him when He called Lazarus out of his tomb and raised him from the dead, bore witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “You see that you are accomplishing nothing. Look, the world has gone after Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were certain Greeks among those who came up to worship at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
