verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, saying, “The hour has come that the Son of Man should be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it produces much grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who loves his life will lose it, and he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone serves Me, let him follow Me; and where I am, there My servant will be also. If anyone serves Me, him My Father will honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now My soul is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But for this purpose I came to this hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, glorify Your name.”
Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people who stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said, “This voice did not come because of Me, but for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all peoples to Myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This He said, signifying by what death He would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever; and how can You say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “A little while longer the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you; he who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become sons of light.” These things Jesus spoke, and departed, and was hidden from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But although He had done so many signs before them, they did not believe in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke:
“Lord, who has believed our report?
And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they could not believe, because Isaiah said again:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts,
Lest they should see with their eyes,
Lest they should understand with their hearts and turn,
So that I should heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things Isaiah said when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless even among the rulers many believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out and said, “He who believes in Me, believes not in Me but in Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who sees Me sees Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in Me should not abide in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone hears My words and does not believe, I do not judge him; for I did not come to judge the world but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who rejects Me, and does not receive My words, has that which judges him—the word that I have spoken will judge him in the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not spoken on My own authority; but the Father who sent Me gave Me a command, what I should say and what I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that His command is everlasting life. Therefore, whatever I speak, just as the Father has told Me, so I speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come that He should depart from this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And supper being ended, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rose from supper and laid aside His garments, took a towel and girded Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel with which He was girded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to Simon Peter. And Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You washing my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will know after this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet!”
Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “He who is bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean; and you are clean, but not all of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He knew who would betray Him; therefore He said, “You are not all clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when He had washed their feet, taken His garments, and sat down again, He said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call Me Teacher and Lord, and you say well, for so I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master; nor is he who is sent greater than he who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen; but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I tell you before it comes, that when it does come to pass, you may believe that I am He.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives Me; and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, “Most assuredly, I say to you, one of you will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter therefore motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, leaning back on Jesus’ breast, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “It is he to whom I shall give a piece of bread when I have dipped it.” And having dipped the bread, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you do, do quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one at the table knew for what reason He said this to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus had said to him, “Buy those things we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having received the piece of bread, he then went out immediately. And it was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself, and glorify Him immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, I shall be with you a little while longer. You will seek Me; and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come,’ so now I say to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this all will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?”
Jesus answered him, “Where I am going you cannot follow Me now, but you shall follow Me afterward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Most assuredly, I say to you, the rooster shall not crow till you have denied Me three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let not your heart be troubled; you believe in God, believe also in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In My Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to Myself; that where I am, there you may be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And where I go you know, and the way you know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going, and how can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also; and from now on you know Him and have seen Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is sufficient for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you so long, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? He who has seen Me has seen the Father; so how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in Me? The words that I speak to you I do not speak on My own authority; but the Father who dwells in Me does the works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe Me that I am in the Father and the Father in Me, or else believe Me for the sake of the works themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me, the works that I do he will do also; and greater works than these he will do, because I go to My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you ask in My name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love Me, keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Helper, that He may abide with you forever—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees Him nor knows Him; but you know Him, for He dwells with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not leave you orphans; I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A little while longer and the world will see Me no more, but you will see Me. Because I live, you will live also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has My commandments and keeps them, it is he who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and manifest Myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, how is it that You will manifest Yourself to us, and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him, “If anyone loves Me, he will keep My word; and My Father will love him, and We will come to him and make Our home with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who does not love Me does not keep My words; and the word which you hear is not Mine but the Father’s who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things I have spoken to you while being present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, He will teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all things that I said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you; not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have heard Me say to you, ‘I am going away and coming back to you.’ If you loved Me, you would rejoice because I said, ‘I am going to the Father,’ for My Father is greater than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now I have told you before it comes, that when it does come to pass, you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will no longer talk much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming, and he has nothing in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave Me commandment, so I do. Arise, let us go from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are already clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abide in Me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine, you are the branches. He who abides in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit; for without Me you can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not abide in Me, he is cast out as a branch and is withered; and they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it shall be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As the Father loved Me, I also have loved you; abide in My love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you keep My commandments, you will abide in My love, just as I have kept My Father’s commandments and abide in His love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things I have spoken to you, that My joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is My commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greater love has no one than this, than to lay down one’s life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are My friends if you do whatever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No longer do I call you servants, for a servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, for all things that I heard from My Father I have made known to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatever you ask the Father in My name He may give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I command you, that you love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. Yet because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who hates Me hates My Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have seen and also hated both Me and My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this happened that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But these things I have told you, that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you of them.
“And these things I did not say to you at the beginning, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now I go away to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth. It is to your advantage that I go away; for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you; but if I depart, I will send Him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He has come, He will convict the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of sin, because they do not believe in Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of righteousness, because I go to My Father and you see Me no more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of judgment, because the ruler of this world is judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I still have many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when He, the Spirit of truth, has come, He will guide you into all truth; for He will not speak on His own authority, but whatever He hears He will speak; and He will tell you things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will glorify Me, for He will take of what is Mine and declare it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things that the Father has are Mine. Therefore I said that He will take of Mine and declare it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me, because I go to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of His disciples said among themselves, “What is this that He says to us, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’; and, ‘because I go to the Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said therefore, “What is this that He says, ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is saying.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus knew that they desired to ask Him, and He said to them, “Are you inquiring among yourselves about what I said, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; and you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman, when she is in labor, has sorrow because her hour has come; but as soon as she has given birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And in that day you will ask Me nothing. Most assuredly, I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name He will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things I have spoken to you in figurative language; but the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figurative language, but I will tell you plainly about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day you will ask in My name, and I do not say to you that I shall pray the Father for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came forth from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came forth from the Father and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world and go to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to Him, “See, now You are speaking plainly, and using no figure of speech!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we are sure that You know all things, and have no need that anyone should question You. By this we believe that You came forth from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed the hour is coming, yes, has now come, that you will be scattered, each to his own, and will leave Me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I have spoken to you, that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation; but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke these words, lifted up His eyes to heaven, and said: “Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son also may glorify You,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as You have given Him authority over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many as You have given Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work which You have given Me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have manifested Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they have known that all things which You have given Me are from You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given to them the words which You have given Me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came forth from You; and they have believed that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I pray for them. I do not pray for the world but for those whom You have given Me, for they are Yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to You. Holy Father, keep through Your name those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. Those whom You gave Me I have kept; and none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I come to You, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should keep them from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify them by Your truth. Your word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As You sent Me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified by the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not pray for these alone, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they all may be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You; that they also may be one in Us, that the world may believe that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory which You gave Me I have given them, that they may be one just as We are one:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in them, and You in Me; that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I desire that they also whom You gave Me may be with Me where I am, that they may behold My glory which You have given Me; for You loved Me before the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O righteous Father! The world has not known You, but I have known You; and these have known that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have declared to them Your name, and will declare it, that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples over the Brook Kidron, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place; for Jesus often met there with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, having received a detachment of troops, and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that would come upon Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom are you seeking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Jesus said to them, “I am He.” And Judas, who betrayed Him, also stood with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when He said to them, “I am He,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then He asked them again, “Whom are you seeking?”
And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I have told you that I am He. Therefore, if you seek Me, let these go their way,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, “Of those whom You gave Me I have lost none.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink the cup which My Father has given Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the detachment of troops and the captain and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they led Him away to Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was high priest that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought Peter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, “You are not also one of this Man’s disciples, are you?”
He said, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the servants and officers who had made a fire of coals stood there, for it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues and in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and in secret I have said nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you ask Me? Ask those who have heard Me what I said to them. Indeed they know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had said these things, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Do You answer the high priest like that?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why do you strike Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. Therefore they said to him, “You are not also one of His disciples, are you?”
He denied it and said, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of him whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter then denied again; and immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, and it was early morning. But they themselves did not go into the Praetorium, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said to him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him up to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate said to them, “You take Him and judge Him according to your law.”
Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying by what death He would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate entered the Praetorium again, called Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Are you speaking for yourself about this, or did others tell you this concerning Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests have delivered You to me. What have You done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would fight, so that I should not be delivered to the Jews; but now My kingdom is not from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate therefore said to Him, “Are You a king then?”
Jesus answered, “You say rightly that I am a king. For this cause I was born, and for this cause I have come into the world, that I should bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no fault in Him at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they all cried again, saying, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then Pilate took Jesus and scourged Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put on Him a purple robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they struck Him with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate then went out again, and said to them, “Behold, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no fault in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, “Behold the Man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify Him, crucify Him!”
Pilate said to them, “You take Him and crucify Him, for I find no fault in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and went again into the Praetorium, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to crucify You, and power to release You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You could have no power at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on Pilate sought to release Him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If you let this Man go, you are not Caesar’s friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, “Behold your King!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they cried out, “Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!”
Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?”
The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. Then they took Jesus and led Him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the center.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was:
JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘He said, “I am the King of the Jews.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His garments and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and also the tunic. Now the tunic was without seam, woven from the top in one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said therefore among themselves, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says:
“They divided My garments among them,
And for My clothing they cast lots.”
Therefore the soldiers did these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus therefore saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, “Woman, behold your son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the disciple, “Behold your mother!” And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a vessel full of sour wine was sitting there; and they filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on hyssop, and put it to His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And bowing His head, He gave up His spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, because it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true; and he knows that he is telling the truth, so that you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things were done that the Scripture should be fulfilled, “Not one of His bones shall be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again another Scripture says, “They shall look on Him whom they pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly, for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in strips of linen with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there they laid Jesus, because of the Jews’ Preparation Day, for the tomb was nearby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first day of the week Mary Magdalene went to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and were going to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?”
She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?”
She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said to Him, “Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have laid Him, and I will take Him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to her, “Mary!”
She turned and said to Him, “Rabboni!” (which is to say, Teacher).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Do not cling to Me, for I have not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say to them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Thomas, called the Twin, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord.”
So he said to them, “Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, “Peace to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to Thomas, “Reach your finger here, and look at My hands; and reach your hand here, and put it into My side. Do not be unbelieving, but believing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way He showed Himself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.”
They said to him, “We are going with you also.” They went out and immediately got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore; yet the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus said to them, “Children, have you any food?”
They answered Him, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they cast, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the multitude of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment (for he had removed it), and plunged into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, as soon as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter went up and dragged the net to land, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty-three; and although there were so many, the net was not broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” Yet none of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who are You?”—knowing that it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is now the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?”
He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.”
He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?”
He said to Him, “Yes, Lord; You know that I love You.”
He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, “Do you love Me?”
And he said to Him, “Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You.”
Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most assuredly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not wish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, “Lord, who is the one who betrays You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
